title: Chiefs Shutout for 2nd Time This Season, Royals Cruise 3-0
text:
Chiefs Shutout for 2nd Time This Season, Royals Cruise 3-0 - SWX Right Now-Sports for Spokane, CdA, Tri-Cities, WA Member Center: Chiefs Shutout for 2nd Time This Season, Royals Cruise 3-0 by John Collett, SWX Reporter Subban, Pacioretty help Canadiens beat Leafs, improve to 9-0 P.K. Subban and Max Pacioretty each had a goal and an assist as the Montreal Canadiens beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 5-3 on Saturday night to extend their season-opening winning streak to nine games. SpokaneChiefs.com 
SPOKANE, Wash. - The Spokane Chiefs couldn't solve Victoria's rookie goaltender Griffen Outhouse on Saturday night at Spokane Arena, losing 3-0. Outhouse made 24 saves in the winning effort. 
Victoria found the net first, just 1:59 into regulation, to take a 1-0 lead. Rookie Matthew Phillips beat Chiefs’ starting goalie Tyson Verhelst off an assist from Dante Hannoun. 
The Royals added to their lead under five minutes later as Jack Walker rifled one from the right circle to put Victoria up 2-0. The goal, which came on a power play earned after a Too Many Men penalty on the Chiefs, was assisted by Royals’ captain Joe Hicketts and Phillips. 
Verhelst kept the Chiefs in the game all the way to the end – he made 23 saves on 26 shots – but the Royals found their icing on the cake at the 15:52 of the third period as Ryan Peckford punched in a rebound to reach the final margin. Walker and Tyler Soy earned assists. 
The game dropped the Chiefs to 4-6-1-1 on the year for 10 points while Victoria broke a four-game losing skid and improved their record to 8-5-0-0. 
Spokane went 0-for-5 on the power play and 5-for-6 on the penalty kill. 
The Chiefs hit the road for their next six games, beginning in Medicine Hat on Wednesday, October 28.They next return home for another TicketsWest Player Magnet Giveaway Night at Spokane Arena on Wednesday, November 11 as they host the Everett Silvertips. Seahawks Blow Another 4th Quarter Lead, Fall to Panthers 27-23 The Seahawks fall to 2-4 on the season after Sunday's 27-23 loss to Carolina. Some late heroics from Cam Newton showed that the Carolina Panthers being unbeaten is no fluke.Winning on the home field of the two-time NFC champions sure proved it.Newton threw a 26-yard touchdown pass to Greg Olsen with 32 seconds left and the Panthers moved to 5-0, rallying for a stunning 27-23 win over the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday. October 7 2015 2:35 AM EDT 2015-10-07 06:35:00 GMT Hudson Elyniuk led the offense with a career high 2 goals as the Chiefs improved their record to 3-1 to take over first place in the U.S. Division with 6 points. Tyson Verhelst turned aside 33 shots, including all 13 in the third period, as the Spokane Chiefs notched their second straight win with a 3-1 victory over the Victoria Royals Tuesday night in Victoria, B.C. Hudson Elyniuk led the offense with a career high 2 goals as the Chiefs improved their record to 3-1 to take over first place in the U.S. Division with 6 points. More >> Anderson-Dolan Impresses in Season Opener, Leads Chiefs to 6-4 Win Over Americans Jaret Anderson-Dolan scored a hat-trick in the Chiefs season opener, on the way to a 6-4 win. Rookie forward Jaret Anderson-Dolan picked an opportune time to score the first three goals of his young WHL career, netting a hat trick to lead the Spokane Chiefs to a come-from-behind 6-4 win over the rival Tri-City Americans on Saturday Night at Spokane Arena. Forward Hudson Elynuik earned the distinction of scoring the Chiefs' first goal of the 2015-16 regular season, punching in a rebound opportunity just 1:14 into regulation.
